article.text: Wednesday 16 May 2012 Shelling continues as UN monitors arrive in Syria UN mission hopes fade as Syrian regime mocks peace plan UN head denounces Syrian regime Leading article: The UN counts the cost in Syria Syrian troops resume shelling of residential areas Scotland has elevated far beyond Theresa May’s 40p proclamation then, with an impetus to enforce a m... An Argentine government video that shows an Argentine athlete training on the Falklands Islands / Ma... Christian Schulz of Berenberg Bank has calculated that total exposure of the rest of the world is ju... Syrian rebels on today delivered six UN ceasefire monitors who had been caught up in attack that killed at least 21 people over to their UN colleagues, a rebel source said. He said the observers, who had been with rebels in the town since the previous day, departed Khan Sheikhoun in a U.N. vehicle that came from Damascus to retrieve them. They had stayed overnight with rebel forces who said it would be unsafe for them to leave alone. Get free wi-fi and exclusive i content while you enjoy a tasty pint of Heineken at participating pubs.
